children: A 26-year-old woman is evaluated for a pigmented skin lesion that has expanded in diameter over 6 months.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Superficial spreading melanoma is the most common variant of malignant melanoma. It presents as a well-defined, asymmetric patch or plaque with an irregular border and variation in color, and initially spreads horizontally. Most skin cancers occur on sun-exposed skin, but superficial spreading melanoma tends to occur on the back in men and the legs in women (areas that receive intermittent sun exposure and are prone to sunburn).
